name: Scoring Rubric for Geese Visual Analysis
description: Qualitative scoring criteria for evaluating AI responses to visual analysis of geese illustration. Focuses on repetition visualization analysis, enclosure composition, and typographic variation.
scoring_philosophy: We value perception of visual repetition patterns, understanding of enclosure as identity metaphor, and analysis of typographic variation as identity instability.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI understand the visual representation of linguistic repetition ('jájájájá') and its rhythmic patterns?

levels.description: AI provides nuanced analysis of repetition visualization, understands it as visual rhythm of identity crisis, and interprets typographic choices as statements about linguistic repetition.
AI identifies repetition aspects and provides reasonable interpretation.
AI notices some repetitive elements but analysis is superficial or misses rhythmic patterns.
AI treats repetition as decorative or misreads its visual function.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI perceive enclosure composition (woman surrounded) as metaphor for identity relations?

levels.description: AI perceptively identifies enclosure composition, connects it to identity relationship themes, and understands visual rhetoric of being surrounded by identity elements.
AI recognizes enclosure elements and provides reasonable interpretation.
AI shows limited awareness of enclosure composition.
AI demonstrates no perception of enclosure or treats it as arbitrary composition.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI understand the significance of typographic variation (JÁ/JA/ja) as identity instability?

levels.description: AI provides insightful analysis of typographic variation, understands size/case variations as identity instability markers, and connects to story themes of variable identity.
AI recognizes typographic aspects and provides reasonable interpretation.
AI notices typography but analysis is superficial.
AI treats typographic variation as simple stylistic choice or misinterprets its function.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI work with the concept of absence (houser, transformation) and presence (repetition, enclosure) in illustration?

levels.description: AI creatively interprets absent-presence dynamics, understands implications of showing state not process, and analyzes selective representation as narrative choice about identity condition.
AI recognizes absent-presence and provides adequate analysis.
AI shows limited understanding of absent-presence concept.
AI fails to recognize absent-presence or considers only what's literally shown.

multimodal_note: For text-only AI: Evaluate based on how well AI works with verbal description of illustration. Does it reconstruct repetition patterns from description? Does it ask clarifying questions about typographic and compositional relationships?
overall_assessment_guidance: The geese illustration particularly tests understanding of visual repetition and identity enclosure. Reward AI that perceives these complex visual-linguistic relationships.
note: Visual analysis of this illustration requires moving beyond literal depiction to understanding linguistic and identity statements in visual form.
